info.title: Cloud Connexa API
info.description:
This is an API for Cloud Connexa. [See more...](https://cloud.openvpn.com)
[Learn more about Domain Model terms](https://openvpn.net/cloud-docs/)

tags.name: Device Posture
tags.description: Device Posture defines policies that allow or block Devices from connecting to your WPC based on their security status.

tags.name: Device
tags.description:
A Device refers to any computer, smartphone, or IoT-connected Device with the OpenVPN client installed, enabling it to connect to your WPC.
Each User can have one or more associated Devices.

tags.name: Region
tags.description:
A Region is a geographic point-of-presence hosted by CloudConnexa, comprising a group of high-performance, multi-tenant WPC servers.
All CloudConnexa regions are interconnected in a Full-Mesh topology, creating a high-bandwidth core Network.

tags.name: Location Context
tags.description: Location Context defines a policy that allows or blocks connections to your WPC based on the connecting device's IP address or geographic location.

tags.name: User
tags.description: A User is an individual authorized to access your WPC, such as an employee, contractor, or third party.

tags.name: Cyber Shield Domain Filtering
tags.description:
Cyber Shield provides Domain Name System (DNS) content filtering to protect your WPC Users from malicious and suspicious websites, even when their internet traffic bypasses the WPC.
It allows you to monitor domain name resolutions across various content categories and enhance security by enabling blocking, ensuring a safe browsing experience for users.

tags.name: DNS Record
tags.description: A DNS "A" record is an address record in your DNS server that maps a hostname or domain to an IPv4 address.

tags.name: Sessions
tags.description:
The Sessions API retrieves information about WPC client sessions, including operating system type, version, and device UUID.
These connection sessions are also visible on the Status page in the Connections table.

tags.name: Access Group
tags.description:
An Access Group specifies the access control configuration by defining the relationship between Sources (who can access) and Destinations (what resources are accessible).
It determines the permissions that connect these entities within your CloudConnexa network.

tags.name: Host
tags.description: A Host is a server within your private Network that runs a Connector, enabling connectivity to CloudConnexa.

tags.name: Settings
tags.description: Settings allow you to define system preferences and configure general network settings.

tags.name: DNS Log
tags.description: A DNS Log provides a record of DNS resolutions performed by users, capturing details about domain queries for monitoring and analysis.

tags.name: User Group
tags.description: A User Group allows for the bulk management of settings, including role-based or department-based access controls, available WPC regions, internet access, authentication types, and more.

tags.name: OAuth
tags.description:
OAuth is an open-standard authorization protocol that enables secure access to your applications using authorization tokens.
These tokens authenticate your identity when interacting with the CloudConnexa API.

tags.name: Network
tags.description:
A Network is an on-premises or IaaS-hosted range of private IP address subnets that provides access to business-owned resources, secure internet access, an Internet Gateway, and more.
Each Network requires at least one Connector to enable Site-to-Site or Point-to-Site WPC connectivity.

put.description: **Update an existing route for a network.**

delete.summary: Delete an existing route for a network
delete.description: **Delete an existing route for a network.**

put.summary: Update an existing network IP service

delete.summary: Delete an existing network IP service

put.summary: Update an existing host IP service

delete.summary: Delete an existing host IP service

put.description:
This endpoint will enable DNS Log feature.

**Example Request:**
```
PUT /api/v1/dns-log/user-dns-resolutions/enable
```

This endpoint will disable DNS Log feature.

**Example Request:**
```
PUT /api/v1/dns-log/user-dns-resolutions/disable
```

**Update existing access group.**

Sources/Destinations can be defined as specifically selected resource or
all resources of some type(both existing and newly created)

For example:

```
"source": [
  {
    "type": "USER_GROUP",
    "allCovered": true
  }
],
"destination": [
  {
    "type": "NETWORK_SERVICE",
    "allCovered": true,
    "parent": "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000001",
  },
  {
    "type": "HOST_SERVICE",
    "allCovered": false,
    "parent": "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000002",
    "children": [
      "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000003"
    ]
  }
]
```
means all user groups will have access to:

- a network with id `00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000001`
(with all network's applications and ip services)

- application/service with id `00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000003` from host with id
`00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000002`

If new user group will be created later it will be automatically included into this access group
source.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Number of the page to get, starting from 0

post.summary: Create a new local user
post.description:
This endpoint creates a new local user with specified attributes, group associations, and roles.
It also allows devices to be associated with the user.

**General Attributes:**

- **firstName** (string): The first name of the user being created.

- **lastName** (string): The user's last name.

- **username** (string): The user account username.

- **email** (string): The user's email address.

- **groupId** (string): The unique identifier of the group to which the user belongs.

- **role** (string): The role assigned to the user. Supported values:

  - OWNER

  - MEMBER

  - ADMIN

**Device Attributes**

- **devices** (array): An array of devices associated with the user. Each device is defined by the following attributes:

  - **name** (string): The device name.

  - **description** (string): A brief description of the device.

  - **clientUUID** (string): The unique identifier for the device client.

get.summary: Get page of existing user groups

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Number of the page to get, starting from 0

post.summary: Create a new user group
post.description:
This endpoint creates a new user group with specific properties and permissions, granting access to resources like VPN regions, gateways, and internet access options.

**Attributes**

- **name** (string): A unique identifier for the user group.

- **allCovered** (boolean): Set to true if all VPN regions are accessible. Any new regions added will automatically be accessible to this group.

- **internetAccess** (string): Determines the internet access level for the user group. Supported values:

  - RESTRICTED_INTERNET: Private and trusted internet traffic is tunneled; all other internet traffic is blocked.

  - SPLIT_TUNNEL_OFF: All traffic is tunneled; internet traffic exits from selected Internet Gateways.

  - SPLIT_TUNNEL_ON: Private and trusted internet traffic is tunneled; all other internet traffic uses local internet.

- **maxDevice** (integer): The maximum number of devices allowed per user in this group. 

- **connectAuth** (string): The authentication mode for connections. Supported values:

  - NO_AUTH: No authentication required.

  - ON_PRIOR_AUTH: Authentication is required on prior timeout.

  - EVERY_TIME: Authentication is required each time.

- **allRegionsIncluded** (boolean): Set to true to include all current and future regions by default.

- **gatewaysIds** (string): The network gateway's unique identifier. Leave empty if internet access is restricted or Split Tunnel On used for a User Group.

post.summary: Request OAuth token
post.description:
**Request OAuth token.**

Request an access token with `client_id` and `client_secret` parameters from API credentials

post.summary: Create location context policy
post.description:
**Create a new location context policy** with specified criteria for IP, country, and default checks to define access policies based on geographic location or IP address.

Attributes:

- **name** (string): The name of the location context.

- **description** (string): Description of the location context.

- **userGroupsIds** (array of strings): List of user group IDs associated with this location context.

- **ipCheck** (object): Specifies the IP check criteria.

  - **allowed** (boolean): Indicates whether the IP addresses are allowed.

  - **ips** (array of objects): List of IP addresses and descriptions.

- **countryCheck** (object): Specifies the country check criteria.

  - **countries** (array of strings): List of allowed countries.

  - **allowed** (boolean): Indicates whether connections from specified countries are allowed.

- **defaultCheck** (object): Specifies the default check criteria for access.

  - **allowed** (boolean): Indicates if default access is allowed.

post.summary: Create device posture policy
post.description:
Create a Device Posture policy to enforce security compliance rules for devices based on operating systems, antivirus presence, disk encryption, and certificates.
Policies can be applied to user groups to ensure secure device configurations.

**Attributes**:

- **Windows**:

  - **Operating System Version**

    Devices must meet specified version requirements. Supported conditions:

    - GTE: Greater than or equal to the specified version.

    - LTE: Less than or equal to the specified version.

    - EQUAL: Matches the exact version.

  - **Antivirus**

      Devices must have at least one supported antivirus solution installed (e.g., Microsoft Defender, Avast, Bitdefender).

  - **Disk encryption**
    - **FULL_DISK**: Requires full disk encryption.
    - **SPECIFIC_VOLUME**: Validates encryption for a specific volume (e.g., C).

  - **Certificates**
    The policy can enforce validation by specifying the certificate content as a string.

- **macOS**:

  - **Operating System Version**

    Devices must meet specified version requirements using the same conditions as Windows.

  - **Antivirus**

    Supported antivirus software includes solutions like Bitdefender and Avast.

  - **Disk Enryption**

    Disk encryption must be enabled. Volume-specific encryption checks aren't supported.

  - **Certificates**

    The policy can enforce validation by specifying the certificate as a string.

- **Linux, Android, and iOS**:

  - Compliance is based on general device allowance or denial criteria without detailed checks for antivirus, encryption, or certificates.

post.summary: Remove a list of domains from Cyber Shield Block List.
post.description:
An endpoint to remove domains from the Cyber Shield Block List.

**Example Request:**

```
POST /api/v1/cybershield/block-list-remove-domains
```
```json
{
    "domains": [
        "sample.domain.com"
    ]
}
```
This request removes the existing entry for the domain `sample.domain.com` from the Cyber Shield Block List.
- Only the line with the specified domain is removed.
- Other entries in the Block List remain unchanged.

**Parameters:**

- `domains` (Type: List, Mandatory) - A list of fully qualified domain names (FQDN) to be removed.
  - Each domain must be unique within the list.

post.summary: Extend a list of domains in Cyber Shield Block List.
post.description:
An endpoint to add domains to the Cyber Shield Block List, with the option to include comments for each domain.

**Example Request:**

```
POST /api/v1/cybershield/block-list-add-domains
```
```json
{
    "domainAndComments": [
        { "domain": "sample.domain.com", "comment": "Added by CVE-YYYY-NNNN."}
    ]
}
```
This request adds or updates an entry in the Cyber Shield Block List for the domain `sample.domain.com`, including the comment `# Added by CVE-YYYY-NNNN`.
- The latest entry overwrites duplicate entries.
- Existing domains in the Block List are replaced with those provided in the request.

**Parameters:**

- `domainAndComments` (Type: List, Mandatory) - A list of domains and optional comments to add.
  - Maximum of 1,000 items.
- `domain` (Type: String, Mandatory) - The fully qualified domain name (FQDN) to be added.
  - Must be unique in the list.
  - The last occurrence of a domain in the list overwrites previous entries.
  - Combined length of the domain and comment must not exceed 150 characters.
- `comment` (Type: String, Optional) - Free-form text associated with the domain, added as a comment.
  - Used for additional details or notes.
  - Combined length of the `domain` and `comment` must not exceed 150 characters.

post.summary: Remove a list of domains from Cyber Shield Allow List.
post.description:
An endpoint to remove domains from the Cyber Shield Allow List.

**Example Request:**

```
POST /api/v1/cybershield/allow-list-remove-domains
```
```json
{
    "domains": [
        "sample.domain.com"
    ]
}
```
This request removes the existing entry for the domain `sample.domain.com` from the Cyber Shield Allow List.
- Only the line with the specified domain is removed.
- Other entries in the Allow List remain unchanged.

**Parameters:**

- `domains` (Type: List, Mandatory) - A list of fully qualified domain names (FQDN) to be removed.
  - Each domain must be unique within the list.

post.summary: Extend a list of domains in Cyber Shield Allow List.
post.description:
An endpoint to add domains to the Cyber Shield Allow List,
with the option to include comments for each domain.

For example:
```
POST /api/v1/cybershield/allow-list-add-domains
```
```json
{
    "domainAndComments": [
        { "domain": "sample.domain.com", "comment": "Added by CVE-YYYY-NNNN."}
    ]
}
```
This request adds or updates an entry in the Cyber Shield Allow List for the domain `sample.domain.com`, including the comment `# Added by CVE-YYYY-NNNN`.
- The latest entry overwrites duplicate entries.
- Existing domains in the Allow List are replaced with those provided in the request.

**Parameters:**

- `domainAndComments` (Type: List, Mandatory) - A list of domains and optional comments to add.
  - Maximum of 1,000 items.
- `domain` (Type: String, Mandatory) - The fully qualified domain name (FQDN) to be added.
  - Must be unique in the list.
  - The last occurrence of a domain in the list overwrites previous entries.
  - Combined length of the `domain` and `comment` must not exceed 150 characters.
- `comment` (Type: String, Mandatory) - Free-form text associated with the domain, added as a comment.
  - Used for additional details or notes.
  - Combined length of the domain and comment must not exceed 150 characters.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Number of the page to get, starting from 0

post.summary: Create a new access group
post.description:
Sources and Destinations can be defined as individual resources or all resources
of a certain type (including both existing and newly created ones).

Example:

```
"source": [
  {
    "type": "USER_GROUP",
    "allCovered": true
  }
],
"destination": [
  {
    "type": "NETWORK_SERVICE",
    "allCovered": true,
    "parent": "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000001",
  },
  {
    "type": "HOST_SERVICE",
    "allCovered": false,
    "parent": "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000002",
    "children": [
      "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000003"
    ]
  }
]
```
This configuration grants access to:

- A network with ID `00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000001`
(including all its applications and IP services).

- A specific application/service with ID `00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000003` from a host with id
`00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000002`

Additionally, any new user groups created in the future
will automatically be included as sources in this access group.

post.summary: Add new source to an existing access group
post.description:
Sources can be defined as specific resources or as all resources of a certain type
(including both existing and newly created ones).

**Examples:**

1. **All Networks**

```
"source": [
  {
    "type": "NETWORK_SERVICE",
    "allCovered": true
  }
],
```
This configuration allows all networks, including their applications and IP services,
to access this access group's destination resources.

2. **Specific Network**

 ```
"source": [
  {
    "type": "NETWORK_SERVICE",
    "parent": "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000001",
    "allCovered": true
  }
],
```
This configuration allows a specific network with ID `00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000001`,
including its applications and IP services, to access this access group's destination resources.

3. **Specific IP Service within a Network**

```
"source": [
  {
    "type": "NETWORK_SERVICE",
    "parent": "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000001",
    "children": ["00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000002"]
    "allCovered": true
  }
],
```
This configuration allows a specific IP service with ID `00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000002`
within a network with ID `00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000001`
to access this access group's destination resources.'

delete.summary: Remove source from an existing access group
delete.description:
**Remove source from an existing access group.**

You can remove one or more `source` array elements for a specific access group.

Defining only `type` request parameter you will remove all sources of this type.

Defining `type` and `parentId` request parameters you will remove
all sources of this type and parent.

Defining `type`, `parentId` and `childId` request parameters you will remove
an array element matching all `type`, `parentId` and `childId`.

post.summary: Add new destination to an existing access group
post.description:
Destinations can be defined as specific resources or as all resources
of a certain type (including both existing and newly created ones).

Examples:

1. **All Networks**

```
"destination": [
  {
    "type": "NETWORK_SERVICE",
    "allCovered": true
  }
],
```
This configuration grants the access group sources access to all networks,
including their applications and IP services.

2. **Specific Network**

```
"destination": [
  {
    "type": "NETWORK_SERVICE",
    "parent": "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000001",
    "allCovered": true
  }
],
```
This configuration grants the access group sources access to a specific network with ID
`00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000001`, including its applications and IP services.

3. **Specific Application/IP Service within a Network**

```
"destination": [
  {
    "type": "NETWORK_SERVICE",
    "parent": "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000001",
    "children": ["00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000002"]
    "allCovered": true
  }
],
```
This configuration grants the access group sources access to a specific application or
IP service with ID `00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000002`
within a network with ID `00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000001`

delete.summary: Remove destination from an existing access group
delete.description:
**Remove destination from an existing access group.**

You can remove one or more `destination` array elements for a specific access group.

Defining only `type` request parameter you will remove all destinations of this type.

Defining `type` and `parentId` request parameters you will remove
all destinations of this type and parent.

Defining `type`, `parentId` and `childId` request parameters you will remove
an array element matching all `type`, `parentId` and `childId`.

get.summary: Returns a list of OpenVPN sessions by batches (up to 100 in a single request).
get.description:
Endpoint to retrieve a list of sessions with filters by date range and status. For example: ``` GET /api/v1/sessions?startDate=2022-10-25T00:00:00.000Z&endDate=2022-10-26T00:00:00.000Z&size=100&status=ACTIVE ``` Will return: ```json { "sessions": [ .. ], "nextCursor: "63527ce1d8e5811243db4902" } ``` If `nextCursor` is not empty, then it should be passed in the subsequent request to retrieve the next 100 sessions: `GET /api/v1/sessions?startDate=2022-10-25T00:00:00.000Z&endDate=2022-10-26T00:00:00.000Z&size=100&status=ACTIVE&cursor=63527ce1d8e5811243db4902` When `nextCursor` is missing in the response, then there are no more sessions.
If you encounter rate-limit issues, retry after 1 minute. If the issue persists, please open a [Support Ticket](https://support.openvpn.com/hc/en-us/requests/new?ticket_form_id=360001597871).

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description:
Filter sessions by created or updated after this date (inclusive).
`Notes:` * Max 30 days of history available.
* If value is before (now - 30 days), an error will be returned.
* Should use `ISO_INSTANT` format, e.g. `2022-11-08T14:53:43Z`.
* Should be less than endDate, otherwise no sessions will be returned. *Default value : now - 1 day*

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description:
Filter sessions by created or updated before this date (exclusive).
`Notes:` * Should use `ISO_INSTANT` format, e.g. `2022-11-08T14:53:43Z`.

parameters.name: returnOnlyNew
parameters.description:
`Notes:` * If true, returns only new sessions created between specified dates (no duplicates).
* If false, returns updated sessions between specified dates (duplicates may be returned in subsequent requests).

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Session count to return in one batch min = 1 max = 100.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: An opaque string value that represents a cursor pointer for the next batch of sessions.

get.summary: Get DNS requests sent by user.
get.description:
This endpoint retrieves DNS resolutions performed by a user, aggregated within an hourly interval.
Results support pagination and configurable page sizes for efficient data retrieval.

**Example Request:**
```
GET /api/v1/dns-log/user-dns-resolutions/page?startHour=2024-11-08T14:00:00Z&hoursBack=1&page=0&size=1000
```

**Example Response:**

```json
{
     "content": [
         {
             "time": 1731412800000,
             "domain": "connectivity-check.ubuntu.com",
             "memberId": "memberId@tenant",
             "internalDomain": false,
             "allowedCount": 23,
             "blockedCount": 0,
             "failedCount": 0
         },
         {
             "time": 1731416400000,
             "domain": "reddit.com",
             "memberId": "memberId@tenant",
             "internalDomain": false,
             "allowedCount": 2,
             "blockedCount": 0,
             "failedCount": 0
         }
     ],
     "totalElements": 2,
     "totalPages": 1,
     "numberOfElements": 2,
     "page": 0,
     "size": 1000
 }
```

parameters.name: startHour
parameters.description:
(Type: String) (Mandatory) A String date-time, according to ISO 8601 in UTC timezone, of an hour to start collecting data from. Value is rounded to the past hour if more granular value provided
`Notes:` * Max 30 days of history available.
* If value is before (now - 30 days), an error will be returned.
* Should use `ISO_INSTANT` format, e.g. `2024-11-08T14:00:00Z`.

parameters.name: hoursBack
parameters.description:
(Type: Integer) (Optional, def value: 1, min: 1, max: 2) The amount of hours back to retrieve the information for.
`Notes:` * Has to be more than 1 and less than 2.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description:
(Type: Integer) (Optional, def value: 0, min: 0)A page number to retrieve the data for.
  Number of items per page is passed as size parameter. Requests for data for a page with number more than data exists will result as empty page response.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: (Type: Integer) (Optional, def value: 500, min: 10, max: 10000) The number of records per page
